item.name: Contact person
item.description: The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person.

item.name: Description of RAC
item.description: The product description of a remote access card.

item.name: Firmware Version of RAC
item.description: The firmware version of a remote access card.

item.name: FQDN of System
item.description: The fully qualified domain name of the system. For example, hostname.domainname.

item.name: Global State of Storage
item.description: The overall storage status being monitored by the remote access card.

item.name: Global State of System
item.description: The overall rollup status of all components in the system being monitored by the remote access card. Includes system, storage, IO devices, iDRAC, CPU, memory, etc.

item.name: Manufacturer of RAC
item.description: The product manufacturer of a remote access card.

item.name: Model of System
item.description: The model name of the system.

item.name: Name of RAC
item.description: The product name of a remote access card.

item.name: NodeID of System
item.description: The node ID of the system. The node ID provides a unique identifier for the system.

item.name: OS Name of System
item.description: The name of the operating system that the host is running.

item.name: OS Version of System
item.description: The version of the operating system that the host is running.

item.name: Physical Location of the device
item.description: The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor').

item.name: Power State of System
item.description:
The power state of the system.
other(1), -- the power state status is not one of the following: unknown(2), -- the power state status is unknown off(3), -- system power is off on(4) -- system power is on

item.name: Rack Name of System
item.description: The Rack locator of the system.

item.name: Service Tag of System
item.description: The service tag of the system.

item.name: Short Name of RAC
item.description: The short product name of a remote access card.

item.name: System description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: System ID of System
item.description: The system ID of the system.

item.name: System name
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name.

item.name: Uptime of System
item.description: The power-up time of the system in seconds.

item.name: URL of RAC
item.description: The out-of-band UI URL of a remote access card.

item.name: Version of RAC
item.description: The product version of a remote access card.

discovery_rule.name: Amperage Probes
discovery_rule.description: The location of the amperage probe.

item_prototype.name: Chassis Index of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The index (one based) of the system chassis.

item_prototype.name: Discrete Reading of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The reading for an amperage probe of type amperageProbeTypeIsDiscrete. When the value for amperageProbeType is other than amperageProbeTypeIsDiscrete, a value is not returned for this attribute. When the value for amperageProbeType is amperageProbeTypeIsDiscrete, the value returned for this attribute is the discrete reading for the probe.

item_prototype.name: Location Name of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The location of the amperage probe.

item_prototype.name: Lower Critical Threshold of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The lower critical threshold of the amperage probe. The value is an integer representing the amperage of the threshold in amps.

item_prototype.name: Lower Non-Critical Threshold of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The lower noncritical threshold of the amperage probe. The value is an integer representing the amperage of the threshold in amps.

item_prototype.name: Lower Non-Recoverable Threshold of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The lower nonrecoverable threshold of the amperage probe. The value is an integer representing the amperage of the threshold in amps.

item_prototype.name: Reading of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The reading for an amperage probe of type other than amperageProbeTypeIsDiscrete.
When the value for amperageProbeType is amperageProbeTypeIsPowerSupplyAmps or amperageProbeTypeIsSystemAmps, the value returned for this attribute is the power usage that the probe is reading in tenths of Amps.
When the value for amperageProbeType is amperageProbeTypeIsPowerSupplyWatts or amperageProbeTypeIsSystemWatts, the value returned for this attribute is the power usage that the probe is reading in Watts.
When the value for amperageProbeType is other than amperageProbeTypeIsDiscrete, amperageProbeTypeIsPowerSupplyAmps, amperageProbeTypeIsPowerSupplyWatts, amperageProbeTypeIsSystemAmps or amperageProbeTypeIsSystemWatts, the value returned for this attribute is the amperage that the probe is reading in Milliamps.
When the value for amperageProbeType is amperageProbeTypeIsDiscrete, a value is not returned for this attribute.

item_prototype.name: State of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The state settings of the amperage probe.
-- If set to 0 (zero), object has no state settings enabled and is disabled unknown(1), -- object's state is unknown enabled(2), -- object's state is disabled (offline) if bit is off or enabled (online) if bit is on notReady(4), -- object's state is not ready enabledAndNotReady(6)

item_prototype.name: Status of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The probe status of the amperage probe.
other(1), -- probe status is not one of the following: unknown(2), -- probe status is unknown (not known or monitored) ok(3), -- probe is reporting a value within the thresholds nonCriticalUpper(4), -- probe has crossed upper noncritical threshold criticalUpper(5), -- probe has crossed upper critical threshold nonRecoverableUpper(6), -- probe has crossed upper non-recoverable threshold nonCriticalLower(7), -- probe has crossed lower noncritical threshold criticalLower(8), -- probe has crossed lower critical threshold nonRecoverableLower(9), -- probe has crossed lower non-recoverable threshold failed(10) -- probe is not functional

item_prototype.name: Upper Critical Threshold of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The upper critical threshold of the amperage probe. The value is an integer representing the amperage of the threshold in amps.

item_prototype.name: Upper Non-Critical Threshold of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The upper noncritical threshold of the amperage probe. The value is an integer representing the amperage of the threshold in amps.

item_prototype.name: Upper Non-Recoverable Threshold of Amperage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The upper nonrecoverable threshold of the amperage probe. The value is an integer representing the amperage of the threshold in amps.

trigger_prototype.name: Amperage Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is failed
trigger_prototype.description: The probe is not functional.

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Amperage Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is critical
trigger_prototype.description: The probe has crossed lower or upper critical threshold.

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Amperage Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-critical
trigger_prototype.description: The probe has crossed lower or upper noncritical threshold

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Amperage Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-recoverable
trigger_prototype.description: The probe has crossed lower or upper non-recoverable threshold.

discovery_rule.name: Batteries
discovery_rule.description: The battery's Fully Qualified Device Descriptor (FQDD) as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: Display Name of Battery "$1"
item_prototype.description: The battery's friendly FQDD as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: FQDD of Battery "$1"
item_prototype.description: The battery's Fully Qualified Device Descriptor (FQDD) as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: Predicted Capacity of Battery "$1"
item_prototype.description:
This entry is obsolete. Use the batteryComponentStatus or batteryState instead.
unknown(1) failed(2) ready(3)

item_prototype.name: State of Battery "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The status of the battery itself without the propagation of any contained component status.
Possible values: 1: Other 2: Unknown 3: OK 4: Non-critical 5: Critical 6: Non-recoverable

item_prototype.name: Status of Battery "$1"
item_prototype.description:
Current state of battery.
Possible values: 1: The current state could not be determined. 2: The battery is operating normally. 3: The battery has failed and needs to be replaced. 4: The battery temperature is high or charge level is depleting. 5: The battery is missing or not detected. 6: The battery is undergoing the re-charge phase. 7: The battery voltage or charge level is below the threshold.

trigger_prototype.name: Battery "{#SNMPVALUE}" has failed
trigger_prototype.description: The battery has failed and needs to be replaced.

trigger_prototype.name: Battery "{#SNMPVALUE}" is charging
trigger_prototype.description: The battery is undergoing the re-charge phase.

trigger_prototype.name: Battery "{#SNMPVALUE}" is missing
trigger_prototype.description: The battery is missing or not detected.

trigger_prototype.name: Battery "{#SNMPVALUE}" temperature is high
trigger_prototype.description: The battery temperature is high or charge level is depleting.

trigger_prototype.name: Battery "{#SNMPVALUE}" voltage is below the threshold
trigger_prototype.description: The battery voltage or charge level is below the threshold.

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Battery "{#SNMPVALUE}" is critical
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the object is critical (failure).

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Battery "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-critical
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the object is warning, non-critical

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Battery "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-recoverable
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the object is non-recoverable (dead)

discovery_rule.description: The location name of the cooling device.

item_prototype.name: Chassis Index of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: The index (one based) of the associated system chassis.

item_prototype.name: Cooling Unit Index of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: This attribute defines the index to the associated cooling unit.

item_prototype.name: Discrete Reading of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: he reading for a cooling device of type coolingDeviceSubTypeIsDiscrete. When the value for coolingDeviceSubType is other than coolingDeviceSubTypeIsDiscrete, a value is not returned for this attribute. When the value for coolingDeviceSubType is coolingDeviceSubTypeIsDiscrete, the value returned for this attribute is the discrete reading for the cooling device.

item_prototype.name: FQDD of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: Fully qualified device descriptor (FQDD) of the cooling device.

item_prototype.name: Location Name of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: The location name of the cooling device.

item_prototype.name: Lower Critical Threshold of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: The lower critical threshold of the cooling device. The value is an integer representing fan speed in revolutions per minute (RPM). It is not applicable to OFF/ON type cooling devices or non-cooling device types.

item_prototype.name: Lower Non-Critical Threshold of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: The lower noncritical threshold of the cooling device. The value is an integer representing fan speed in revolutions per minute (RPM). It is not applicable to OFF/ON type cooling devices or non-cooling device types.

item_prototype.name: Reading of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: The reading for a cooling device of subtype other than coolingDeviceSubTypeIsDiscrete. When the value for coolingDeviceSubType is other than coolingDeviceSubTypeIsDiscrete, the value returned for this attribute is the speed in RPM or the OFF/ON value of the cooling device. When the value for coolingDeviceSubType is coolingDeviceSubTypeIsDiscrete, a value is not returned for this attribute.

item_prototype.name: State of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The state settings of the cooling device.
-- If set to 0 (zero), object has no state settings enabled and is disabled unknown(1), -- object's state is unknown enabled(2), -- object's state is disabled (offline) if bit is off or enabled (online) if bit is on notReady(4), -- object's state is not ready enabledAndNotReady(6)

item_prototype.name: Status of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The probe status of the cooling device.
other(1), -- probe status is not one of the following: unknown(2), -- probe status is unknown (not known or monitored) ok(3), -- probe is reporting a value within the thresholds nonCriticalUpper(4), -- probe has crossed upper noncritical threshold criticalUpper(5), -- probe has crossed upper critical threshold nonRecoverableUpper(6), -- probe has crossed upper non-recoverable threshold nonCriticalLower(7), -- probe has crossed lower noncritical threshold criticalLower(8), -- probe has crossed lower critical threshold nonRecoverableLower(9), -- probe has crossed lower non-recoverable threshold failed(10) -- probe is not functional

item_prototype.name: Type of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description:
This attribute defines the type of the cooling device.
coolingDeviceTypeIsOther(1), -- type is other than following values coolingDeviceTypeIsUnknown(2), -- type is unknown coolingDeviceTypeIsAFan(3), -- type is Fan coolingDeviceTypeIsABlower(4), -- type is Centrifugal Blower coolingDeviceTypeIsAChipFan(5), -- type is Fan on Integrated Circuit coolingDeviceTypeIsACabinetFan(6), -- type is Cabinet Fan coolingDeviceTypeIsAPowerSupplyFan(7), -- type is Power Supply Fan coolingDeviceTypeIsAHeatPipe(8), -- type is Heat Pipe coolingDeviceTypeIsRefrigeration(9), -- type is Integrated Refrigeration Unit coolingDeviceTypeIsActiveCooling(10), -- type is Active Cooling Device coolingDeviceTypeIsPassiveCooling(11) -- type is Passive Cooling Device

item_prototype.name: Upper Critical Threshold of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: The upper critical threshold of the cooling device. The value is an integer representing fan speed in revolutions per minute (RPM). It is not applicable to OFF/ON type cooling devices or non-cooling device types.

item_prototype.name: Upper Non-Critical Threshold of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: The upper noncritical threshold of the cooling device. The value is an integer representing fan speed in revolutions per minute (RPM). It is not applicable to OFF/ON type cooling devices or non-cooling device types.

item_prototype.name: Upper Non-Recoverable Threshold of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: The upper nonrecoverable threshold of the cooling device. The value is an integer representing fan speed in revolutions per minute (RPM). It is not applicable to OFF/ON type cooling devices or non-cooling device types.

item_prototype.name: Upper Non-Recoverable Threshold of Cooling Device "$1"
item_prototype.description: The lower nonrecoverable threshold of the cooling device. The value is an integer representing fan speed in revolutions per minute (RPM). It is not applicable to OFF/ON type cooling devices or non-cooling device types.

discovery_rule.name: Physical disks
discovery_rule.description: The physical disk's name as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: Bus Type of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The bus type of the physical disk.
Possible values: 1: The bus type could not be determined. 2: Small Computer System Interface (SCSI). 3: Serial Attached SCSI (SAS). 4: Serial Advanced Technology Attachment (SATA). 5: Fibre channel

item_prototype.name: Display Name of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The physical disk's friendly FQDD as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: FQDD of Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}"
item_prototype.description: The physical disk's Fully Qualified Device Descriptor (FQDD) as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.description: The amount of free space in bytes on the physical disk.

item_prototype.name: Manufacturer Name of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The name of the physical disk's manufacturer.

item_prototype.name: Name of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The physical disk's name as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: Operational State of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The state of the physical disk when there are progressive operations ongoing.
Possible values: 1: There is no active operation running. 2: Data from a redundant virtual disk is currently being rebuilt onto the physical disk. 3: Data on the disk is being erased. 4: Data is being copied from a hot spare disk to the physical disk or vice versa.

item_prototype.name: Operation Progress on Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The progress percentage of the operation that is being performed on the physical disk. This is applicable only if there is a progressive operations ongoing.

item_prototype.name: Part Number of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The part number of the disk.

item_prototype.name: Product ID of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The physical disk's unique identification number from the manufacturer.

item_prototype.name: Revision of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The firmware version of the physical disk.

item_prototype.name: S.M.A.R.T Status of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: Indicates whether the physical disk has received a predictive failure alert.

item_prototype.name: Serial Number of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The physical disk's unique identification number from the manufacturer.

item_prototype.name: Size of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The size of the physical disk in bytes.

item_prototype.name: State of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The status of the physical disk itself without the propagation of any contained component status.
Possible values: 1: Other 2: Unknown 3: OK 4: Non-critical 5: Critical 6: Non-recoverable

item_prototype.name: Status of Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The current state of this physical disk.
Possible states: 1: The current state could not be determined. 2: The physical disk is available for use, but no RAID configuration has been assigned. 3: A RAID configuration has been assigned to the physical disk. 4: The physical disk has been moved from another controller and contains all or some portion of a virtual disk. 5: The physical disk is not available to the RAID controller. 6: The physical disk is currently blocked by controller. 7: The physical disk is not operational. 8: The physical disk is not a RAID capable disk 9: The physical disk has been removed.

item_prototype.name: Used space on Physical Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The amount of used space in bytes on the physical disk.

trigger_prototype.name: Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" has been removed
trigger_prototype.description: The physical disk has been removed.

trigger_prototype.name: Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" has failed
trigger_prototype.description: The physical disk is not operational.

trigger_prototype.name: Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is being copied [{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}]
trigger_prototype.description: Data is being copied from a hot spare disk to the physical disk or vice versa.

trigger_prototype.name: Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is being erased [{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}]
trigger_prototype.description: Data on the disk is being erased.

trigger_prototype.name: Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is being rebuilt [{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}]
trigger_prototype.description: Data from a redundant virtual disk is currently being rebuilt onto the physical disk.

trigger_prototype.description: The physical disk is currently blocked by controller.

trigger_prototype.name: Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is foreign
trigger_prototype.description: The physical disk has been moved from another controller and contains all or some portion of a virtual disk.

trigger_prototype.name: Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-raid
trigger_prototype.description: The physical disk is not a RAID capable disk

trigger_prototype.name: Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is offline
trigger_prototype.description: The physical disk is not available to the RAID controller.

trigger_prototype.name: S.M.A.R.T Status of Physical Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is not good
trigger_prototype.description: The physical disk has received a predictive failure alert.

item_prototype.description: The index (one based) of the system chassis.

item_prototype.description: Fully qualified device descriptor (FQDD) of the power supply.

item_prototype.description: The location of the power supply.

item_prototype.description: The maximum sustained output wattage of the power supply (in Watts).

item_prototype.description: The index to the associated power unit if the power supply is part of a power unit.

item_prototype.name: Rated Input of Power Supply "$1"
item_prototype.description: The rated input wattage of the power supply (in Watts).

item_prototype.name: State of Power Supply "$1"
item_prototype.description:
This attribute defines the state settings of the power supply.
-- If 0 (zero), there are no power supply state setting -- Note: These values are bit masks, so combination values are possible. unknown(1), -- state settings are unknown onLine(2), -- power supply is enabled (online) notReady(4), -- power supply is not ready fanFailure(8), -- power supply fan has failed onlineAndFanFailure(10), powerSupplyIsON(16), -- power supply is supplying power powerSupplyIsOK(32), -- power supply is indicating it is OK acSwitchIsON(64), -- power supply is indicating AC power switch is on onlineandAcSwitchIsON(66), acPowerIsON(128), -- power supply is indicating AC power is on onlineAndAcPowerIsON(130), onlineAndPredictiveFailure(210), acPowerAndSwitchAreOnPowerSupplyIsOnIsOkAndOnline(242)

item_prototype.name: Status of Power Supply "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The status of the power supply.
other(1), -- the status of the object is not one of the following: unknown(2), -- the status of the object is unknown (not known or monitored) ok(3), -- the status of the object is ok nonCritical(4), -- the status of the object is warning, non-critical critical(5), -- the status of the object is critical (failure) nonRecoverable(6) -- the status of the object is non-recoverable (dead)

item_prototype.name: Status of Sensor on Power Supply "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The state reported by the power supply sensor. This attribute supplements the attribute powerSupplyStateSettingsUnique.
-- Note: These values are bit masks, so combination values are possible. presenceDetected(1), -- state is Presence detected psFailureDetected(2), -- state is PS Failure detected predictiveFailure(4), -- state is Predictive Failure psACLost(8), -- state is PS AC lost acLostOrOutOfRange(16), -- state is AC lost or out-of-range acOutOfRangeButPresent(32), -- state is AC out-of-range, but present configurationError(64) -- state is Configuration error

item_prototype.name: Type of Power Supply "$1"
item_prototype.description:
This attribute defines the type of the power supply.
powerSupplyTypeIsOther(1), -- type is other than following values powerSupplyTypeIsUnknown(2), -- type is unknown powerSupplyTypeIsLinear(3), -- type is Linear powerSupplyTypeIsSwitching(4), -- type is Switching powerSupplyTypeIsBattery(5), -- type is Battery powerSupplyTypeIsUPS(6), -- type is Uninterruptible Power Supply powerSupplyTypeIsConverter(7), -- type is Converter powerSupplyTypeIsRegulator(8), -- type is Regulator powerSupplyTypeIsAC(9), -- type is AC powerSupplyTypeIsDC(10), -- type is DC powerSupplyTypeIsVRM(11) -- type is VRM

item_prototype.description:
This attribute defines the reading of the battery.
-- Note: These values are bit masks, so combination values are possible. predictiveFailure(1), -- battery predictive failure failed(2), -- battery failed presenceDetected(4) -- battery presence detected

item_prototype.name: State of System Battery "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The state settings of the battery.
-- If set to 0 (zero), object has no state settings enabled and is disabled unknown(1), -- object's state is unknown enabled(2), -- object's state is disabled (offline) if bit is off or enabled (online) if bit is on notReady(4), -- object's state is not ready enabledAndNotReady(6)

item_prototype.name: Status of System Battery "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The status of the battery.
other(1), -- the status of the object is not one of the following: unknown(2), -- the status of the object is unknown (not known or monitored) ok(3), -- the status of the object is ok nonCritical(4), -- the status of the object is warning, non-critical critical(5), -- the status of the object is critical (failure) nonRecoverable(6) -- the status of the object is non-recoverable (dead)

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Probes
discovery_rule.description: The location name of the temperature probe.

item_prototype.name: Chassis Index of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The index (one based) of the associated system chassis.

item_prototype.name: Discrete Reading of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: This attribute defines the reading for a temperature probe of type temperatureProbeTypeIsDiscrete. When the value for temperatureProbeType is other than temperatureProbeTypeIsDiscrete, a value is not returned for this attribute. When the value for temperatureProbeType is temperatureProbeTypeIsDiscrete, the value returned for this attribute is the discrete reading for the probe.

item_prototype.name: Location of Temperature Probe #$1
item_prototype.description: The location name of the temperature probe.

item_prototype.name: Lower Critical Temperature of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: This attribute defines the lower critical threshold of the temperature probe. The value is an integer representing the temperature of the threshold in tenths of degrees Centigrade.

item_prototype.name: Lower Non-Critical Temperature of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: This attribute defines the lower noncritical threshold of the temperature probe. The value is an integer representing the temperature of the threshold in tenths of degrees Centigrade.

item_prototype.name: Lower Non-Recoverable Temperature of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The lower nonrecoverable threshold of the temperature probe. The value is an integer representing the temperature of the threshold in degrees Centigrade.

item_prototype.name: Reading of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The reading for a temperature probe of type other than temperatureProbeTypeIsDiscrete. When the value for temperatureProbeType is other than temperatureProbeTypeIsDiscrete, the value returned for this attribute is the temperature that the probe is reading in tenths of degrees Centigrade. When the value for temperatureProbeType is temperatureProbeTypeIsDiscrete, a value is not returned for this attribute.

item_prototype.name: State of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The state settings of the temperature probe.
-- If set to 0 (zero), object has no state settings enabled and is disabled unknown(1), -- object's state is unknown enabled(2), -- object's state is disabled (offline) if bit is off or enabled (online) if bit is on notReady(4), -- object's state is not ready enabledAndNotReady(6)

item_prototype.name: Status of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The probe status of the temperature probe.
other(1), -- probe status is not one of the following: unknown(2), -- probe status is unknown (not known or monitored) ok(3), -- probe is reporting a value within the thresholds nonCriticalUpper(4), -- probe has crossed upper noncritical threshold criticalUpper(5), -- probe has crossed upper critical threshold nonRecoverableUpper(6), -- probe has crossed upper non-recoverable threshold nonCriticalLower(7), -- probe has crossed lower noncritical threshold criticalLower(8), -- probe has crossed lower critical threshold nonRecoverableLower(9), -- probe has crossed lower non-recoverable threshold failed(10) -- probe is not functional

item_prototype.name: Upper Critical Temperature of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: This attribute defines the upper critical threshold of the temperature probe. The value is an integer representing the temperature of the threshold in tenths of degrees Centigrade.

item_prototype.name: Upper Non-Critical Temperature of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: This attribute defines the upper noncritical threshold of the temperature probe. The value is an integer representing the temperature of the threshold in tenths of degrees Centigrade.

item_prototype.name: Upper Non-Recoverable Temperature of Temperature Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The upper nonrecoverable threshold of the temperature probe. The value is an integer representing the temperature of the threshold in degrees Centigrade.

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Temperature Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is critical
trigger_prototype.description: The probe has crossed lower or upper critical threshold.

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Temperature Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-critical
trigger_prototype.description: The probe has crossed lower or upper noncritical threshold

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Temperature Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-recoverable
trigger_prototype.description: The probe has crossed lower or upper non-recoverable threshold

trigger_prototype.name: Temperature Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is failed
trigger_prototype.description: The probe is not functional

discovery_rule.name: Virtual disks
discovery_rule.description: The virtual disk's friendly FQDD as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: Bad Blocks on Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: Indicates whether the virtual disk has bad blocks.

item_prototype.name: Display Name of Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The virtual disk's friendly FQDD as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: FQDD of Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The virtual disk's Fully Qualified Device Descriptor (FQDD) as represented in Storage Management.

item_prototype.name: Name of Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The virtual disk's label as entered by the user.

item_prototype.name: Operational State of Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The state of the virtual disk when there are progressive operations ongoing.
Possible values: 1: There is no active operation running. 2: The virtual disk configuration has changed. The physical disks included in the virtual disk are being modified to support the new configuration. 3: A Consistency Check (CC) is being performed on the virtual disk. 4: The virtual disk is being initialized. 5: BackGround Initialization (BGI) is being performed on the virtual disk.

item_prototype.name: Operation Progress on Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The progress percentage of the operation that is being performed on the virtual disk. This is applicable only if there is a progressive operations ongoing.

item_prototype.name: RAID Type of Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The virtual disk's RAID type.
Possible values: 1: Not one of the following 2: RAID-0 3: RAID-1 4: RAID-5 5: RAID-6 6: RAID-10 7: RAID-50 8: RAID-60 9: Concatenated RAID 1 10: Concatenated RAID 5

item_prototype.name: Size of Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description: The size of the virtual disk in bytes.

item_prototype.name: State of Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The status of the virtual disk itself without the propagation of any contained component status.
Possible values: 1: Other. 2: Unknown. 3: OK. 4: Non-critical . 5: Critical. 6: Non-recoverable.

item_prototype.name: Status of Virtual Disk "$1"
item_prototype.description:
The current state of this virtual disk (which includes any member physical disks). Possible states:
1: The current state could not be determined. 2: The virtual disk is operating normally or optimally. 3: The virtual disk has encountered a failure. The data on disk is lost or is about to be lost. 4: The virtual disk encounterd a failure with one or all of the constituent redundant physical disks. The data on the virtual disk might no longer be fault tolerant.

trigger_prototype.name: A Consistency Check of Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" [{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}]
trigger_prototype.description: A Consistency Check (CC) is being performed on the virtual disk.

trigger_prototype.name: Adding new PDs to Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" [{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}]
trigger_prototype.description: The virtual disk configuration has changed. The physical disks included in the virtual disk are being modified to support the new configuration.

trigger_prototype.name: Background initialisation of Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" [{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}]
trigger_prototype.description: BackGround Initialization (BGI) is being performed on the virtual disk.

trigger_prototype.name: Initialisation of Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" [{ITEM.LASTVALUE2}]
trigger_prototype.description: The virtual disk is being initialized.

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is critical
Status of Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-critical
Status of Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-recoverable
Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" has a failure
trigger_prototype.description: The virtual disk has encountered a failure. The data on disk is lost or is about to be lost.

trigger_prototype.name: Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" has a failure with one or all of PDs
trigger_prototype.description: The virtual disk encounterd a failure with one or all of the constituent redundant physical disks. The data on the virtual disk might no longer be fault tolerant.

trigger_prototype.name: Virtual Disk "{#SNMPVALUE}" has detected bad blocks
trigger_prototype.description: The virtual disk has bad blocks.

item_prototype.name: Upper Non-Critical Threshold of Voltage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The upper non-critical threshold of the voltage probe. The value is an integer representing the voltage of the threshold in millivolts.

item_prototype.name: Upper Non-Recoverable Threshold of Voltage Probe "$1"
item_prototype.description: The upper non-recoverable threshold of the voltage probe. The value is an integer representing the voltage of the threshold in volts.

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Voltage Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is critical
trigger_prototype.description: The probe has crossed lower or upper critical threshold.

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Voltage Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-critical
trigger_prototype.description: The probe has crossed lower or upper non-critical threshold

trigger_prototype.name: Status of Voltage Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is non-recoverable
trigger_prototype.description: The probe has crossed lower or upper non-recoverable threshold

trigger_prototype.name: Voltage Probe "{#SNMPVALUE}" is failed
trigger_prototype.description: The probe is not functional.

trigger.name: Firmware Version of Remote Access Card (RAC) has been changed
Host {HOST.NAME} global storage status is critical
trigger.description: The status of the object is critical (failure)

trigger.name: Host {HOST.NAME} global storage status is non-critical
trigger.description: The status of the object is warning, non-critical

trigger.name: Host {HOST.NAME} global storage status is non-recoverable
trigger.description: The status of the object is non-recoverable (dead)

trigger.name: Host {HOST.NAME} global system status is critical
trigger.description: The status of the object is critical (failure)

trigger.name: Host {HOST.NAME} global system status is non-critical
trigger.description: The status of the object is warning, non-critical

trigger.name: Host {HOST.NAME} global system status is non-recoverable
trigger.description: The status of the object is non-recoverable (dead)

trigger.name: Host {HOST.NAME} is not available by SNMP
